text: Martha Joan Hart (; born October 31, 1966) is a Canadian philanthropist and researcher who is the widow of professional wrestler Owen Hart. After her husband's death in an accident at a WWF event, Hart sued the World Wrestling Federation. She later wrote a bestselling book about her husband's life and founded a charity in his name. She has subsequently been involved in several legal cases involving her husband's image and has worked as a philanthropist and researcher. ==References== ==Other websites== * Martha Hart Biography * * Owen Hart Foundation official website * Martha Hart Interview * Champions Of Learning Category:1966 births Category:Writers from Alberta Category:Canadian philanthropists Category:Canadian psychologists Category:Hart family members Category:People from Calgary Category:Living people Category:University of Calgary alumni
